alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a nitrobenzene moiety, which consists of a benzene ring with a carbon bearing a nitro group.
alternative_parents.name: Nitrobenzenes

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an ethenylbenzene moiety.
alternative_parents.name: Styrenes

alternative_parents.description: C-nitro compounds where the nitro group is C-substituted with an aromatic group.
alternative_parents.name: Nitroaromatic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an acyl moiety of benzoic acid with the formula (C6H5CO-).
alternative_parents.name: Benzoyl derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic aromatic compounds that contain a ketone group substituted at one C-atom with an aryl group. They have the generic structure RC(=O)R', where R = aryl group and R'=organyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Aryl ketones

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing the enone functional group, with the structure RC(=O)CR'.
alternative_parents.name: Enones

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the acryloyl functional group (which has the core fragment but-3-en-2-one).
alternative_parents.name: Acryloyl compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic 1,3-dipolar compounds with the general structure  X#N+-Z- <-> X-=N+=Z <-> X-=N-Z+ <-> X-N=Z (X = C or O, Z = C, N, or O).
alternative_parents.name: Propargyl-type 1,3-dipolar organic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds comprising the oxoazanium cation, with the formula N+=O.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxoazanium compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a nitrogen atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organonitrogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

class.description: Organic compounds with a structure based on a C6-C3-C6 skeleton, where the two benzene rings are not linked together.
class.name: Linear 1,3-diarylpropanoids

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as retrochalcones. These are a form of normal chalcones that are structurally distinguished by the lack of oxygen functionalities at the C2'- and C6'-positions.

direct_parent.description: A form of normal chalcones that are structurally distinguished by the lack of oxygen functionalities at the C2'- and C6'-positions.
direct_parent.name: Retrochalcones

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Organic compounds containing 1,3-Diphenylpropenone (benzylideneacetophenone), ArCH=CH(=O)Ar, or its derivatives formed by substitution.
subclass.name: Chalcones and dihydrochalcones

superclass.description: Organic compounds that are synthesized either from the amino acid phenylalanine (phenylpropanoids) or the decarboxylative condensation of malonyl-CoA (polyketides). Phenylpropanoids are aromatic compounds based on the phenylpropane skeleton. Polyketides usually consist of alternating carbonyl and methylene groups (beta-polyketones), biogenetically derived from repeated condensation of acetyl coenzyme A (via malonyl coenzyme A), and usually the compounds derived from them by further condensations.
superclass.name: Phenylpropanoids and polyketides
